title: The Onondaga. South Corner Riveriside Drive and 152nd Street.

text:
Riverside Park, at the foot of West 152nd Street, showing shacks and house-boats occupying the marginal strip at the waters edge.

Buildings in the background are on Riverside Drive, extending from 151st on right, to 156th Street on the left. At the latter point is the 13 story Rivera. Trinity Cemetery nestles in the hollow to the center, and is encircled by a steel viaduct carrying the Drive.

April 13, 1934
Views: 1-2

P. L. Sperr
title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 152nd Street (West).

text:
(1) A squatters shack at 145th Street and the Hudson River. April 13, 1934.
P.L. Sperr.

(2) A squatters shack made from a houseboat next to the N.Y.C.R.R. tracks, at 152nd Street and Riverside Drive. April 13, 1934.
P.L. Sperr.

title: Squatters Colony at the Hudson River.

text:
Riverside Drive from the Public Comfort Station north, of West 152nd Street, looking southwards, showing R. R. Tracks lower drive and Hudson River.
P. L. Sperr  May 18, 1940
